CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper September 1, 1945, pg. 4, reads: "Librarian - Miss Ida Mary Lewis, brilliant daughter of Mr. and Mrs. M. F. Lewis of McNaugher Street, North Side, was recently appointed apprentice librarian at the Carnegie Free Library on Federal Street, marking the first time a colored student has received such a post.  Miss Lewis, who is 20 years old and a graduate of Perry High School, is a senior in the Margaret Morrison College of Carnegie Institute of Technology. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Apprentice librarian Ida Mary Lewis standing before bookcase in Carnegie Library, Northside
